These are the updated PEG ratios after the recent market pullback that's based on expected earnings growth over the next 3 years.

PEG < 1 usually means mispriced growth
PEG > 2 starts to push into the danger zone

Elon is basically making it clear that physical AI is a compute problem & $TSLA intends to own the silicon that solves it.

The company already has millions of its own AI chips deployed in cars & data centers, it is on the 4th generation in production, AI5 is about to tape out & AI6 is already underway. It would be wild if they really hit annual chip refresh cycles & ship more AI silicon into the real world than every other player combined.

Because at that point Tesla becomes the only company with a closed-loop system for physical AI where the fleet generates the data, the models are trained on their own stack & the inference runs on silicon they designed themselves. 

That is the advantage nobody else has.

THE GLOBAL SUPPLY CHAIN IS BEING REBUILT AROUND AI COMPUTE

‚Ä¢ AI Security | $CRWD, $ZS, $PANW, $RBRK

$ASML is the AI kingmaker because every LLM, GPU stack & advanced chip is built using its machines. 

Their EUV tools remain the gateway to every advanced chip $TSM & $NVDA produce.

The 'Rule of 40' is typically calculated by combining the growth rate + operating margin to showcase a profitability adjusted growth metric.

The PEG ratio compares a company‚Äôs P/E multiple to its expected earnings CAGR, typically over the next 3 years so it adjusts valuation for how fast the business is actually growing.

Five names the market threw into the ‚Äúmoat-vulnerable‚Äù bucket that are now wildly undervalued:

1. $DUOL at 18x FCF w/ a Rule-of-40 score of 70
2. $ADBE at 14x FCF w/ a Rule-of-40 score of 49
3. $MNDY at 20x FCF w/ a Rule-of-40 score of 53
4. $HIMS growing 59% w/ 13% EBITDA margins at just 24x EBITDA
5. $PYPL trading at a 0.7 PEG on the next three years of earnings

The market is pricing these like their moats already collapsed but if any of them prove their moats still hold in the new digital economy then the rerate will be explosive.

$AMZN subscription machine is a ~$50B business compounding over 30% a year for a decade.

When a product becomes life infrastructure then you can raise prices without losing customers.

That‚Äôs real pricing power.

$META has filled the May gap in full and has found support near the gap zone.
Now very oversold and has built a potential bullish falling wedge.

The duration of TLT is 15.6*, so it should have a duration of ~78, with massive tracking error and humongous fees. All 4x and 5x funds have significant tracking errors and high fees.

Duration = For an instantaneous 1% move in interest rates, how much will the price move?
